page.title: 01MILTON BRYAN AND BATTLESDEN
page.content:
Gentle rolling slopes, two tiny villages and intensively farmed land characterise the 12 km survey square.
{Milton Bryan}and{Battlesden}are the villages with a combined population of between 200 and 300.
There are only two reasonable sized {woods}in the area and only one classified road, the B528 secondary road from Woburn to Hockliffe. Neither village lies on this road.
{Clipstone Brook,}a tributary of the River Ouzel, traverses the square before flowing on through Leighton Buzzard where it once caused severe flooding.
The soil is clay and gravel.
